page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: The area is well served by a close network of narrow country lanes, and is crossed by the main A548 Abergele to Llanrwst road from north to south and by the B5381 Betws-yn-Rhos road from east to west. This road follows the line of a Roman road built between Deva (Chester) and Kanovium, an auxilliary fort in the Conwy Valley near Tyn-y-Groes. The A548 is the route of the two bus services which provide a link with the main coast road. Most people in the area are of the opinion that the frequency of the services is inadequate and most rely on their own car or other transport. Young people find it most difficult to travel around. The two commercial amenities are situated at the junction of the two main roads.
